text: We are using webhooks to map HubSpot data to our own data.  One thing we would like to do is know when an email we have sent has been replied to.  I believe we should be able to use the hs_sales_email_last_replied to do this.  Is this a correct assumption, and is there any detailed documentation on this one particular event.

Hey folks :wave:

When using Workflow Extensions, can a `TEXTAREA` field’s value be dynamically populated based on a change in another `SELECT` field in the same Custom Action?

As far as I tried and read, there is no way to do so, but I’d like to confirm.

Man! that is rough, I would have expected the timestamps to follow the rules in <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/faq/how-should-timestamps-be-formatted-for-HubSpots-apis|the timestamps doc>. Glad you figured it out.

Hi all, wondering if anyone has used a HubSpot form to speak to a Zendesk API instead of building out a current form based on the instructions seen <https://develop.zendesk.com/hc/en-us/articles/360001068627-Building-a-custom-ticket-form-with-the-Zendesk-API#form|here>. If you have any examples, pointers, or limitations you're able to provide, that would be great!
